title.narrative: Oxfam IBIS efforts in Syria and the region, 2020

description.narrative: Oxfam IBIS efforts in Syria and the region, 2020 - Strengthened protection and resilience of 42,200 crisis-affected people in Syria and Lebanon
FL §06.39.03.11 Other contributions to acute and prolonged crises

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 2. Families and especially women have increased food security and livelihoods
# of farmers w agricultural cash grant and training # of livestock holders w livestock cash grant + training # of small business owners with grants + training

target.value: 2.1 348 HHs received cash grants for agriculture and business training 2.2 400 HHs received cash grants for livestock and business training 2.3. 97 HHs received cash grants for small businesses and business training 2.4. Information about markets and linkages to service providers facilitated for local producers and businesess

title.narrative: 3. Syrian and Lebanese civil society are capacitated to participate and strategically influence the rights and needs of conflict-affected populations

# of meetings held by project partners to plan advocacy efforts # of project partners’ staff trained on research, advocacy, sector-specific issues and tools # of policy products developed by project partners and Oxfam (policy briefs, social media campaigns, infographics, etc.) # meetings held with local/national/international stakeholders

target.value: 3.1 Project partners aligned on policy and advocacy priorities (L) 3.2 Local actors have received trainig and other support for capacity strenghtning (L+S) 3.3 Monitoring, evidence-based reports and briefs produced and disseminated (L + S) 3.4 Relevant stakeholders informed on the conditions of refugees and host communities 3.5 Oxfam and partners + other local leaders participated in relevant meetings and events (L + S)

title.narrative: 1. Girls, boys, women and men have increased access to WASH and protection services (L + S)

# of referrals that are received and responded to # of ECA/protection beneficiaries # of men, women, boys and children w access to information about legal, GBV and public health etc issues # of women and men who receive legal assistance and/or legal consultations # of women and men w WASH facilities incl gender-sensitive latrines # number of solar lights installed # of households w safe grey water systems # women with MHM items #of trained CFPs, CHVs and CTVs # of action plans # of digitised material produced # of men, women, boys and girls w soap and bleach kits distributed # of community based protection initiatives

target.value: Lebanon & Syria 1.1 Oxfam, partners, CFPs and/or CHVs supported refugee population and referred cases to service providers 1.2 150 men and women received ECA/Protection grants 1.3 18,820 men, women, boys and girls with access to awareness rasing on health, COVID-19, GBV services etc 1.4 GBV survivors received case management services including PSS and/or received emotional support sessions Lebanon 1.5 400 women and men received legal consultations and assistance 1.6 161 WASH facilities + kits including latrines constructed, rehabilitated and descommissioned 1.7 411 solar lights are installed 1.8 70 households with installed grey water systems 1.9 2,700 women and girls with Menstrual Hygiene Management 1.10 178 CFPs, 78 CHVs and 14 new CTVs trained on safe identification, referrals or WASH 1.11 2 community groups and 3 women’s groups with developed action plans 1.12 Digitized COVID-19 material produced 1.1 2,700 COVID-19 disinfection kits or hygiene kits distributed

title.narrative: 3. Syrian and Lebanese civil society are capacitated to participate and strategically influence the rights and needs of conflict-affected populations

# of civil society organizations with development plans improving their organizational, thematical and/or advocacy for working with conflict-affected population (S+L)
# of initiatives led by community-based groups and conflict-affected population (S + L)
# of decision makers engaged with at a local and national level through influencing activities.
2. Families and especially women have increased food security and livelihoods
70% of targeted HHs for livelihoods have increased income and/or reduced negative coping mechanisms (S)
1. Girls, boys, women and men have increased access to protection and basic services

90% of targeted Syrian households have access to safe WaSH and sanitation facilities, according to standards (L)
90% of targeted women and girls indicate they have increased ability to manage their menstrual cycle and other hygiene needs (L)
Targeted population, especially girls and women, have increased community-protection and safe and timely access to legal and SGBV services (S + L)

target.value:
90% of targeted Syrian households have access to safe WaSH and sanitation facilities, according to standards (L)
90% of targeted women and girls indicate they have increased ability to manage their menstrual cycle and other hygiene needs (L)
Targeted population, especially girls and women, have increased community-protection and safe and timely access to legal and SGBV services (S + L)
